original: de yang gang gi phyir shin tu tsho zhing sbom ches pa dang ; shin tu skem pa nyid smyung ba dang brta bas gso bar bya ba nyid bstan gyi /
analyzed: de yang gang gi phyir shin tu tsho zhing sbom ches pa dang ; shin tu skem pa nyid smyung ba dang brta bas gso bar bya ba nyid bstan gyi /
translated: Moreover, it is taught that one should be treated with fasting and strengthening therapies for those who are very fat and obese, and for those who are very emaciated.

original: sbom po dang skem po tha mal tsam ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sbom po dang skem po tha mal tsam ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not for those who are merely fat and emaciated.

original: ci'i phyir sbom po bas skem po mchog nyid yin pa'i rigs pa 'dir smras pa ni /
analyzed: ci'i phyir sbom po bas skem po mchog nyid yin pa'i rigs pa 'dir smras pa ni /
translated: Why is it reasonable that the emaciated are superior to the fat?

original: shin tu cho drags pa'i sman zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: shin tu cho drags pa'i sman zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni ma yin te /
translated: This is not said because of a very strong medicine.

original: tshil ches ba dang / shin tu me drod ches pa dang / rlung 'phel ba gang yin pa de lta bu yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: tshil ches ba dang / shin tu me drod ches pa dang / rlung 'phel ba gang yin pa de lta bu yod pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not that there is no one who is very oily, very hot, or has increased wind.

original: shin tu tshil ches pa dang me drod dang rlung sel ba'i sman de lta bu shin tu tsho ches ba'i brta ba dang nyams smad par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: shin tu tshil ches pa dang me drod dang rlung sel ba'i sman de lta bu shin tu tsho ches ba'i brta ba dang nyams smad par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: Such a medicine that eliminates oiliness, heat, and wind is not able to strengthen or weaken the very oily.

original: de la sbom po'i brta ba'i sman gyis sbom po bzlog pa'am /
analyzed: de la sbom po'i brta ba'i sman gyis sbom po bzlog pa'am /
translated: In that case, a strengthening medicine for the fat cannot cure the fat,

original: nyams smad par nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: nyams smad par nus pa ma yin te /
translated: or it cannot weaken it.

original: gang gi phyir brta zhing 'phel bar byed pa ni sha la sogs pas byed la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir brta zhing 'phel bar byed pa ni sha la sogs pas byed la /
translated: , cause firmness and growth.

original: des ni tshil 'phel bar byed de /
analyzed: des ni tshil 'phel bar byed de /
translated: It causes the growth of fat.

original: brta ba'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir tshil kho na sogs par byed do //
analyzed: brta ba'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir tshil kho na sogs par byed do //
translated: Only fat causes firmness, because it has the nature of firmness.🔽Whatever is a medicine for emaciation, such as garlic, etc.

original: nyams smad pa'i sman khre rgod la sogs pa gang yin pa 'di ni nyams smad pa'i rang bzhin can yin pa'i phyir rlung 'phel bar byed do //
analyzed: nyams smad pa'i sman khre rgod la sogs pa gang yin pa 'di ni nyams smad pa'i rang bzhin can yin pa'i phyir rlung 'phel bar byed do //
translated: , causes the growth of wind, because it has the nature of emaciation.

original: de ni 'di skad ston pa yin te /
analyzed: de ni 'di skad ston pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being taught:

original: gal te shin tu sbom ches pa la brta ba'i sman byin na ni /
analyzed: gal te shin tu sbom ches pa la brta ba'i sman byin na ni /
translated: If a medicine for firmness is given to one who is very stout,

original: des tshil dang me drod 'phel bar byed cing rlung 'grib par byed do //
analyzed: des tshil dang me drod 'phel bar byed cing rlung 'grib par byed do //
translated: it causes the growth of fat and digestive heat, and a decrease of wind.

original: 'on te nyams smad pa smyung ba byas na des tshil zad par byed kyi rlung dang me drod la gnod par mi byed do //
analyzed: 'on te nyams smad pa smyung ba byas na des tshil zad par byed kyi rlung dang me drod la gnod par mi byed do //
translated: But if one is emaciated by fasting, it causes the exhaustion of fat, and does not harm wind and digestive heat.

original: de bas na shin tu tsho ches pa la brta ba yang bya dka' la /
analyzed: de bas na shin tu tsho ches pa la brta ba yang bya dka' la /
translated: Therefore, it is difficult to give a medicine for firmness to one who is very stout,

original: nyams smad par yang nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: nyams smad par yang nus pa ma yin no //
translated: and it is not possible to emaciate one who is very thin.

original: zhes bya ba ni rigs pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rigs pa yin te /
translated: This is logical.

original: shin tu cho ches pa la gang tshil zad par bya ba dang / me drod sel ba dang ; rlung sel ba de la phan pa yin na /
analyzed: shin tu cho ches pa la gang tshil zad par bya ba dang / me drod sel ba dang ; rlung sel ba de la phan pa yin na /
translated: If one is very obese, it is beneficial to consume fat, to remove heat from the body, and to remove wind.

original: de lta bu ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu ma yin no //
translated: But this is not the case.

original: gang zhig mngar dang snum bag bza' //
analyzed: gang zhig mngar dang snum bag bza' //
translated: Those who eat sweet and oily foods

original: bsod bde dag gis skem pa sel //
analyzed: bsod bde dag gis skem pa sel //
translated: are emaciated by the bliss of good fortune.🔽By definitely relying on the opposite of that,

original: de las shin tu bzlog pa dag / nges par bsten pas sbom nyid sel //
analyzed: de las shin tu bzlog pa dag / nges par bsten pas sbom nyid sel //
translated: one removes obesity.

original: zhes pa 'di ni skem pa mchog yin pa'i gtan @183b tshigs gzhan dag bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes pa 'di ni skem pa mchog yin pa'i gtan @183b tshigs gzhan dag bstan pa yin te /
translated: This teaches other reasons why emaciation is supreme.

original: skem pa nyid ni gang gi phyir zas mngar bag la sogs pas bde zhing dga' ba med pas zhi bar 'gyur bas /
analyzed: skem pa nyid ni gang gi phyir zas mngar bag la sogs pas bde zhing dga' ba med pas zhi bar 'gyur bas /
translated: Because emaciation is blissful and pleasant due to sweet and oily foods, it is pacifying.

original: de'i phyir sbom po bas skem po nyid mchog yin gyi sbom po ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir sbom po bas skem po nyid mchog yin gyi sbom po ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, emaciation is supreme, not obesity.

original: gang gi phyir sbom po nyid skem par byas pa'i gso ba'i thabs las shin tu go bzlog pa'i tshul bsten pas zlog par byed de /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sbom po nyid skem par byas pa'i gso ba'i thabs las shin tu go bzlog pa'i tshul bsten pas zlog par byed de /
translated: Because obesity is removed by the method of treatment that emaciates, it is removed by relying on the opposite method.

original: shin tu go bzlog pa ni phal cher kha ba dang / tsha ba dang / bska ba dang / zas skom dang sman rtsub mo bsten na /
analyzed: shin tu go bzlog pa ni phal cher kha ba dang / tsha ba dang / bska ba dang / zas skom dang sman rtsub mo bsten na /
translated: The opposite of that is mostly cold, hot, and astringent, and the use of rough food, drink, and medicine.

original: gdod shin tu tsho ches pa'i sbom po sel te /
analyzed: gdod shin tu tsho ches pa'i sbom po sel te /
translated: That [cold] eliminates the very hot and thick [phlegm].

original: tshil zad pa'i rgyu rnams kyis de 'byung gi zas dang skom la sogs pa mngar zhing snum pag zos te /
analyzed: tshil zad pa'i rgyu rnams kyis de 'byung gi zas dang skom la sogs pa mngar zhing snum pag zos te /
translated: The causes of the exhaustion of fat are those [foods and drinks] that are sweet and oily, and so on.

original: bsod cing tshim par byed pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bsod cing tshim par byed pas ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not by eating sweet and nourishing foods and drinks that [fat] arises.

original: de ltar na sbom pa dang skem pa 'di gnyis nad du mnyam pa yin du zin kyang /
analyzed: de ltar na sbom pa dang skem pa 'di gnyis nad du mnyam pa yin du zin kyang /
translated: Thus, although these two, being thick and being emaciated, are equal in terms of being illnesses,

original: sbom por gyur pa ni gso dka' ba yin pas na yun ring 'gor ba'i phyir skem po nyid mchog yin no //
analyzed: sbom por gyur pa ni gso dka' ba yin pas na yun ring 'gor ba'i phyir skem po nyid mchog yin no //
translated: being thick is difficult to cure, so being emaciated is supreme because it lasts a long time.

original: skem po de'i sman ci lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: skem po de'i sman ci lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: What kind of medicine is there for that emaciation?

original: de'i phyir smras pa ni /🔽de la bza' btung sman rnams ni //
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa ni / de la bza' btung sman rnams ni //
translated: Therefore, it is said:🔽For that, apply all the medicines

original: brta bar byed pa thams cad sbyar //
analyzed: brta bar byed pa thams cad sbyar //
translated: that build up.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
translated: And so on.

original: skyes bu skem po de la bza' ba dang btung ba dang sman du 'bras drug cu'i chan dang sha dang 'o ma dang / bu ram shing gi khu ba la sogs pa dang / tsho bar byed pa dang / brta bar byed pa'i sman gyi rigs thams cad brta ba'i don du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: skyes bu skem po de la bza' ba dang btung ba dang sman du 'bras drug cu'i chan dang sha dang 'o ma dang / bu ram shing gi khu ba la sogs pa dang / tsho bar byed pa dang / brta bar byed pa'i sman gyi rigs thams cad brta ba'i don du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: For the emaciated man, one should prepare a gruel of sixty kinds of grains, meat, milk, sugar cane juice, and so on, for eating and drinking and for medicine, and all kinds of medicines for strengthening, for the sake of building him up.

original: sems las med dang dga' ba dang // nges par brta bar bya ba dang // gnyid cher log pas skem pa yang //
analyzed: sems las med dang dga' ba dang // nges par brta bar bya ba dang // gnyid cher log pas skem pa yang //
translated: The emaciated man, who is without thought, happy, well-nourished, and well-rested,

original: phag dang 'dra bar lus rgyas 'gyur //
analyzed: phag dang 'dra bar lus rgyas 'gyur //
translated: will become as fat as a pig.

original: zhes bya ba la /🔽sems las med pa ni mya ngan gyis gdung ba med pa'am /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la / sems las med pa ni mya ngan gyis gdung ba med pa'am /
translated: Here is the explanation.

original: bya ba'i rigs gang yin pa gang yang yid la dpyod pa med pa'o //
analyzed: bya ba'i rigs gang yin pa gang yang yid la dpyod pa med pa'o //
translated: Without thought means without mental anguish or without any mental analysis of what should be done.

original: dga' ba ni nyams bag tu gnas pa'o //
analyzed: dga' ba ni nyams bag tu gnas pa'o //
translated: Happy means living in comfort.

original: nges par brta bar bya ba ni shin tu tshim par bya ba dang / de bzhin du legs par gnyid log cing nyal bas /
analyzed: nges par brta bar bya ba ni shin tu tshim par bya ba dang / de bzhin du legs par gnyid log cing nyal bas /
translated: Well-nourished means very satisfied, and likewise well-rested means having slept well.

original: skem po dag rnam pa thams cad du sha rgyas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skem po dag rnam pa thams cad du sha rgyas par 'gyur ro //
translated: The emaciated become well-nourished in every way.

original: de yang dper na phag dang 'dra ba ste /🔽skem po'i gnas skabs su sha rgyas pa'i rgyu gzhan pas gnyid cher log pa rgyu'i gtso bo yin par bstan par @184a * //
analyzed: de yang dper na phag dang 'dra ba ste / skem po'i gnas skabs su sha rgyas pa'i rgyu gzhan pas gnyid cher log pa rgyu'i gtso bo yin par bstan par @184a * //
translated: This is like the example of a pig.

original: bya ba'i phyir dpe phag pa dang sbyar ba yin no //
analyzed: bya ba'i phyir dpe phag pa dang sbyar ba yin no //
translated: In order to demonstrate that the primary cause of becoming well-nourished while emaciated is sleeping a lot, the example of a pig is used.

original: de ltar sems las med pa dang / dga' ba dang shin tu brta ba dang / legs bar gnyid log pas lus zungs thams cad 'phel zhing rgyas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar sems las med pa dang / dga' ba dang shin tu brta ba dang / legs bar gnyid log pas lus zungs thams cad 'phel zhing rgyas par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, by not having mental activity, by being happy, by being very stable, and by sleeping well, all the body’s constituents increase and expand.

original: lus ni brtas shing tsho byed pa //
analyzed: lus ni brtas shing tsho byed pa //
translated: The body is nourished and satisfied.

original: sha dang 'dra ba gang yang med //
analyzed: sha dang 'dra ba gang yang med //
translated: There is nothing like meat.

original: sha mi za la sha za'i shas //
analyzed: sha mi za la sha za'i shas //
translated: Not eating meat, the meat of the meat-eaters,

original: lus ni mchog tu brtas byed yin //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: lus ni mchog tu brtas byed yin // zhes bya ba la /
translated: is what makes the body most nourished.

original: gang gi lus brtas shing tsho bar byed pa 'di la zas gang zhig zos shing longs spyad pa na /
analyzed: gang gi lus brtas shing tsho bar byed pa 'di la zas gang zhig zos shing longs spyad pa na /
translated: Here, “what makes the body nourished and satisfied” is the food that is eaten and enjoyed.

original: sha dang 'dra bar lus pa rtas shing tsho bar byed pa'i kha zas kyi rigs gang yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sha dang 'dra bar lus pa rtas shing tsho bar byed pa'i kha zas kyi rigs gang yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: There is no other type of food that can nourish and strengthen the body like meat.

original: de las khyad par du sha za rnams kyi sha ni shas skyed cing 'phel bar byed pa yin bas /
analyzed: de las khyad par du sha za rnams kyi sha ni shas skyed cing 'phel bar byed pa yin bas /
translated: In particular, the flesh of carnivorous animals is nourishing and strengthening because it is produced and increased by flesh.

original: shin tu yang lus brtas shing 'phel bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: shin tu yang lus brtas shing 'phel bar byed pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is very nourishing and strengthening.

original: sbom po dang skem bo de gnyis kyi gso ba'i thabs mdor bstan pa'i phyir smras pa ni /
analyzed: sbom po dang skem bo de gnyis kyi gso ba'i thabs mdor bstan pa'i phyir smras pa ni /
translated: To briefly explain the treatment for obesity and emaciation, it is said:

original: sbom la nyams smad lci bas bya //
analyzed: sbom la nyams smad lci bas bya //
translated: For obesity, use light and unctuous foods.

original: de las bzlog pa sge ma la phan //🔽zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de las bzlog pa sge ma la phan // zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: For emaciation, use the opposite.

original: mi sbom po la ni nyams smad pa'i lcibs bya ste /
analyzed: mi sbom po la ni nyams smad pa'i lcibs bya ste /
translated: For those who are not obese, use light and unctuous foods.

original: dper na sbrang rtsi dang srid ga ta zhes bya ba'i 'bras bu dang / padma'i rtsa ba dang sdong bu la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: dper na sbrang rtsi dang srid ga ta zhes bya ba'i 'bras bu dang / padma'i rtsa ba dang sdong bu la sogs pa ste /
translated: For example, honey, the fruit called sṛṅgāṭaka, lotus roots and stems, etc.

original: de dag ni rtsub pa yin pa'i phyir tshil za bar byed pa dang ; lci bas myur du mi 'ju ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni rtsub pa yin pa'i phyir tshil za bar byed pa dang ; lci bas myur du mi 'ju ba'i phyir ro //
translated: These are light because they are rough, and unctuous because they do not quickly digest.

original: sbom po la ni yang ba'i nyams smad pas yang sbom po phan te /
analyzed: sbom po la ni yang ba'i nyams smad pas yang sbom po phan te /
translated: Heavy food is beneficial for the emaciated because it increases the strength of the weak.

original: dper na rgya sran ku lad tha dang / khre rgod la sogs pa phan ba lta bu'o //🔽de las bzlog pa skem la phan //
analyzed: dper na rgya sran ku lad tha dang / khre rgod la sogs pa phan ba lta bu'o // de las bzlog pa skem la phan //
translated: For example, it is beneficial for those with kidney disease, diabetes, and so on.

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The opposite of that is beneficial for the obese.🔽The opposite of the above is light and so on.

original: gang snga ma de las bzlog pa'i yang ba dang ; de bzhin du brta ba de ni skem bo la phan te /
analyzed: gang snga ma de las bzlog pa'i yang ba dang ; de bzhin du brta ba de ni skem bo la phan te /
translated: That is beneficial for the obese.

original: dper na 'bras drug cu pa'i chan dang / ri dags sha bkra dang / ri bong la sogs pa'i sha lta bu ste /
analyzed: dper na 'bras drug cu pa'i chan dang / ri dags sha bkra dang / ri bong la sogs pa'i sha lta bu ste /
translated: For example, it is like the porridge of sixty types of rice, the meat of spotted deer, rabbit, and so on.

original: de yang gang gi phyir shin tu skem pa la ni zas dang skom dang sman gcig pa dag gis me drod 'bri bar byed pas de brtas par byed pa'i rdzas yin du zin kyang de mi 'ju bas slar nyams smod cing skem po nyid du byed par 'gyur
analyzed: de yang gang gi phyir shin tu skem pa la ni zas dang skom dang sman gcig pa dag gis me drod 'bri bar byed pas de brtas par byed pa'i rdzas yin du zin kyang de mi 'ju bas slar nyams smod cing skem po nyid du byed par 'gyur
translated: Moreover, for those who are extremely obese, the same food, drink, and medicine reduce the heat of the digestive fire. Even though it is a substance that nourishes them, it is indigestible and causes further emaciation.

original: ro // nas dang gro ni gnyi ga la //🔽de la 'os par byed pas brtag / ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ro // nas dang gro ni gnyi ga la //🔽de la 'os par byed pas brtag / ces bya ba la /
translated: Barley and wheat are suitable for both.

original: sbom po dang skem po de gnyis ka la 'os shing 'tsham par bya zhing sbyar ba dang / g-yos su byas @184b pa'i nye bar brtag par byas ba gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: sbom po dang skem po de gnyis ka la 'os shing 'tsham par bya zhing sbyar ba dang / g-yos su byas @184b pa'i nye bar brtag par byas ba gang yin pa de ni /
translated: It is to be examined as to whether it is suitable and appropriate for the thin and the fat, and whether it is prepared as a remedy.

original: de la 'os pas brtag ces bya'o //
analyzed: de la 'os pas brtag ces bya'o //
translated: That is called “examination as to suitability.”

original: de ni 'di skad ston pa yin te /
analyzed: de ni 'di skad ston pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being taught:

original: gang gi phyir sbom po la nas dang gro ster ba na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sbom po la nas dang gro ster ba na /
translated: When barley and wheat are given to the fat,

original: de'i tshe sbom bo la 'os shing 'tsham ba'i nyams smad pa'i bya bas bya la /
analyzed: de'i tshe sbom bo la 'os shing 'tsham ba'i nyams smad pa'i bya bas bya la /
translated: then at that time it is to be examined as to whether it is suitable and appropriate for the fat by the action of emaciating.

original: gang gi tshe nas dang gro de nyid skem bo la ster na de'i tshe skem po la 'os shing 'tsham pa'i brta ba bya ba'i tshul gyis brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe nas dang gro de nyid skem bo la ster na de'i tshe skem po la 'os shing 'tsham pa'i brta ba bya ba'i tshul gyis brtag par bya'o //
translated: When barley and wheat are given to the thin, then at that time it is to be examined as to whether it is suitable and appropriate for the thin by the method of nourishing.

original: 'di ni 'di ltar dogs ba skyed par mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni 'di ltar dogs ba skyed par mi bya'o //
translated: This should not give rise to doubt.

original: ji ltar nyes ba rnams kyi nad kyi rgyu mtha' las ba las nad kyang mtha' yas pa ji lta ba bzhin du gso ba yang mtha' yas /
analyzed: ji ltar nyes ba rnams kyi nad kyi rgyu mtha' las ba las nad kyang mtha' yas pa ji lta ba bzhin du gso ba yang mtha' yas /
translated: Just as there are limitless diseases from the causes of faults, so too there are limitless remedies.

original: nyams brta ba dang nyams smad pa'i gso ba'i thabs kyang sbyor ba rab dang rab mchog gi dbye bas mtha' yas bar rigs na /
analyzed: nyams brta ba dang nyams smad pa'i gso ba'i thabs kyang sbyor ba rab dang rab mchog gi dbye bas mtha' yas bar rigs na /
translated: Also, the methods of treatment for enhancing and diminishing experience are limitless when classified as best and best supreme.

original: ci'i phyir gso ba'i thabs gnyis kho nar zad ces phyir rgol ba dag yod pas /
analyzed: ci'i phyir gso ba'i thabs gnyis kho nar zad ces phyir rgol ba dag yod pas /
translated: Why are there only two methods of treatment?

original: de'i phyir gzhung rtsom par byed pas 'dir smras pa ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhung rtsom par byed pas 'dir smras pa ni /
translated: Therefore, the author of the treatise says here:

original: nad kyi dbye ba tha dad kyi //
analyzed: nad kyi dbye ba tha dad kyi //
translated: The classifications of illnesses are different,

original: gcod 'khru la sogs dbye ba yis //
analyzed: gcod 'khru la sogs dbye ba yis //
translated: but due to the classifications of cutting, washing, and so on,

original: nad ltar tha dad gyur kyang ni //
analyzed: nad ltar tha dad gyur kyang ni //
translated: although illnesses become different,

original: gso ba gnyis las yod ma yin //🔽zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: gso ba gnyis las yod ma yin // zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: there is no treatment beyond two.

original: nad rnams zad pa dang / gnas pa dang / steng dang 'og dang rtsib logs la sogs par thad kar 'gro ba la sogs ba'i mchan nyid kyis rnam par dbye na /
analyzed: nad rnams zad pa dang / gnas pa dang / steng dang 'og dang rtsib logs la sogs par thad kar 'gro ba la sogs ba'i mchan nyid kyis rnam par dbye na /
translated: When illnesses are classified by the characteristics of directly moving upward, downward, to the sides, and so on,

original: mtha' yas pa yod du zin kyang /
analyzed: mtha' yas pa yod du zin kyang /
translated: they are limitless.

original: gso ba ni rnam pa gnyis las lhag par dbye ba med do //
analyzed: gso ba ni rnam pa gnyis las lhag par dbye ba med do //
translated: However, treatment does not exceed two types.

original: de bzhin du gcad bar bya ba la sogs pa'i dbye bar phye ba las kyang tha dad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin du gcad bar bya ba la sogs pa'i dbye bar phye ba las kyang tha dad par 'gyur te /
translated: So too, it would be different from the distinctions of what is to be cut and so on.

original: 'di ni gcad ba'i gso ba'o //🔽'di ni rab tu gcad pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni gcad ba'i gso ba'o // 'di ni rab tu gcad pa'o //
translated: This is the cutting of what is to be cut.🔽This is the cutting of what is to be thoroughly cut.

original: 'di ni rab mchog tu gcad pa'o //🔽'di ni rab tu 'khru ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rab mchog tu gcad pa'o // 'di ni rab tu 'khru ba'o //
translated: This is the cutting of what is to be thoroughly and supremely cut.🔽This is the washing of what is to be washed.

analyzed: gang gi phyir skyes bu'i pho ba'i me'i tshad ma shes par snum mang du byin na de mi 'ju zhing srog kyang 'dor bar 'gyur ba srid pa yin no //
translated: Because if one does not know the amount of the fire of the stomach of a person, and gives too much oil, it is possible that it will not be digested and will take away life.

original: da ni snum gyi tshad gsum po de dag gtang ba'i dus dang / gtang ba'i gnas bstan par bya ba'i phyir smras pa ni /
analyzed: da ni snum gyi tshad gsum po de dag gtang ba'i dus dang / gtang ba'i gnas bstan par bya ba'i phyir smras pa ni /
translated: Now, in order to teach the time and place for giving those three measures of oil, it is said:

original: snga de'i zas ni zhu nyid dang // sbyang phyir dangs ma mang du btung //
analyzed: snga de'i zas ni zhu nyid dang // sbyang phyir dangs ma mang du btung //
translated: When the previous food is digested, drink a lot of oil for purification.

original: zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: This is what is being said.

original: snga de zhag gi zas zhu ba tsam nyid kyi dus de nyid de /🔽zas ni zhu bkres pas ni nyen pa'i skabs su sbyang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: snga de zhag gi zas zhu ba tsam nyid kyi dus de nyid de / zas ni zhu bkres pas ni nyen pa'i skabs su sbyang ba'i phyir /
translated: The word “just” means that the time for drinking the oil is just when the previous day’s food is being digested.

original: snum mang du gtang ba nyid la zhun mar dangs ma 'ba' zhig btung bar bsngags pas na /
analyzed: snum mang du gtang ba nyid la zhun mar dangs ma 'ba' zhig btung bar bsngags pas na /
translated: The oil should be given in large quantity, because it is a purgative, and it should be given when the patient is hungry.

original: de'i phyir 'di nyid ces bya ba'i sgra nges par bzung ba'i don du smras pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di nyid ces bya ba'i sgra nges par bzung ba'i don du smras pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the word “just” is said to have the meaning of restriction.

original: snga de zhag gi zan zhu ba nyid na zhes pas chad kyi ltogs pa dang btung bar bya ba yin te /
analyzed: snga de zhag gi zan zhu ba nyid na zhes pas chad kyi ltogs pa dang btung bar bya ba yin te /
translated: The oil is drunk when the previous day’s food is being digested, not when the patient is hungry.

original: de ni gang gi phyir myur ba nyid du 'ju bar byed de /
analyzed: de ni gang gi phyir myur ba nyid du 'ju bar byed de /
translated: This is because it is digested quickly.

original: sbyang ba ma byas par me'i drod shin tu shas che ba yin ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbyang ba ma byas par me'i drod shin tu shas che ba yin ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the heat of the fire is very strong when the bowels are not cleansed.

original: de yang drang srong tsa ra kas /🔽lto ba rlung gi shas che zhing //
analyzed: de yang drang srong tsa ra kas / lto ba rlung gi shas che zhing //
translated: The sage Caraka explains:🔽The stomach has a predominance of wind,

original: rtsol ba che ba'i dang tshul can //
analyzed: rtsol ba che ba'i dang tshul can //
translated: and the person has a strong urge.

original: me drod che ba'i sman rnams ni //
analyzed: me drod che ba'i sman rnams ni //
translated: Medicines with strong digestive heat

original: mi 'khru nyid la myur du 'ju //🔽zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: mi 'khru nyid la myur du 'ju //🔽zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: are not digested and are quickly absorbed.

original: da ni zhi bar bya ba'i snum gyi cho ga smras pa ni /
analyzed: da ni zhi bar bya ba'i snum gyi cho ga smras pa ni /
translated: Now, the rite of oil for pacification is stated:🔽For one to be pacified, it is praised🔽to be given without food,

original: zhi bya ltogs bcas zas med par //
analyzed: zhi bya ltogs bcas zas med par //
translated: with hunger,

original: 'bring tshad tsam ni bsngags pa yin //🔽zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: 'bring tshad tsam ni bsngags pa yin // zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: of medium quantity.

original: zhi bar bya ba la snum zas ma zos par ltogs pa dang bcas pa'i skabs su gtang ba bsngags pa yin la /
analyzed: zhi bar bya ba la snum zas ma zos par ltogs pa dang bcas pa'i skabs su gtang ba bsngags pa yin la /
translated: For one to be pacified, it is praised to be given at a time when one has not eaten oily food, and is hungry.

original: de yang 'bring tshad tsam ste /
analyzed: de yang 'bring tshad tsam ste /
translated: And that is of medium quantity.

original: thun bzhis 'ju ba bsngags shing phan pa yin te /
analyzed: thun bzhis 'ju ba bsngags shing phan pa yin te /
translated: It is praised and beneficial to be digested in four sessions.

original: de yang zas med pa dang ste /
analyzed: de yang zas med pa dang ste /
translated: And that is without food.

original: zas gang dang yang ma bsres par gcig pu gtang ba @197b bsngags pa yin no //
analyzed: zas gang dang yang ma bsres par gcig pu gtang ba @197b bsngags pa yin no //
translated: It is praised to be given alone, without mixing with any food.

original: brta ba'i snum gyi cho ga smras pa ni /
analyzed: brta ba'i snum gyi cho ga smras pa ni /
translated: The rite of oil for strengthening is stated:

original: brta ba sha dang sha khu sogs //
analyzed: brta ba sha dang sha khu sogs //
translated: For strengthening, meat, meat soup, and so on,

original: de yang 'bras chan nyung bcas pa //
analyzed: de yang 'bras chan nyung bcas pa //
translated: and also rice with little soup,

original: byis pa rgan po skom gyis gdungs //
analyzed: byis pa rgan po skom gyis gdungs //
translated: are for children, the aged, those tormented by thirst,🔽those who dislike oil, those who like beer,🔽women, and those who always rely on oil,

original: snum 'gras chang dad che ba dang // bud med snum ni rtag bsten dang // drod chung bde dang dka' mi bzod //
analyzed: snum 'gras chang dad che ba dang // bud med snum ni rtag bsten dang // drod chung bde dang dka' mi bzod //
translated: those with little heat, those who are comfortable, and those who cannot endure hardship.

original: lto snyi nad dkyil chung tsha dus //
analyzed: lto snyi nad dkyil chung tsha dus //
translated: When there is a disorder of the stomach, small intestine, or middle part of the intestine,

original: nyam chung ba la bsngags pa yin //
analyzed: nyam chung ba la bsngags pa yin //
translated: it is praised for the weak.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Thus it is said.

original: brta ba'i snum gyi cho ga ni sha dang sha khu la sogs pa dang lhan cig gtang ba bsngags so //
analyzed: brta ba'i snum gyi cho ga ni sha dang sha khu la sogs pa dang lhan cig gtang ba bsngags so //
translated: The procedure for oil retention is praised when done together with meat, meat soup, and so on.

original: sha khu la sogs pa'i sgras ni bza' ba dang sha khur la sogs pa bsdu'o //
analyzed: sha khu la sogs pa'i sgras ni bza' ba dang sha khur la sogs pa bsdu'o //
translated: The term meat soup and so on includes food and meat broth, and so on.

original: da yang 'bras chan dang bcas pa ste /
analyzed: da yang 'bras chan dang bcas pa ste /
translated: Now, it is together with rice,

original: bza' ba dang bcas bar bya'i /
analyzed: bza' ba dang bcas bar bya'i /
translated: it should be done together with food.

original: gang sbyang ba zhi ba zhes bya ba'i snum gyi cho ga gnyis so //
analyzed: gang sbyang ba zhi ba zhes bya ba'i snum gyi cho ga gnyis so //
translated: There are two procedures for oil retention, one called purification and one called pacification.

original: sngar bshad pa dag ni zas dang bcas bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: sngar bshad pa dag ni zas dang bcas bar mi bya ste /
translated: Those previously explained should not be done together with food,

original: gnyi ga yang zas kyi dus su bza' ba bkag ba yin no //
analyzed: gnyi ga yang zas kyi dus su bza' ba bkag ba yin no //
translated: because both are prohibited to be eaten at mealtime.

original: de yang nyung du ste chung du yin pa la yang de ni byis pa dang rgan po la sogs pa la yang phan pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang nyung du ste chung du yin pa la yang de ni byis pa dang rgan po la sogs pa la yang phan pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, it is little, small, and that is also beneficial for children, the elderly, and so on.

original: de bzhin du skom gyis gdungs shing skom dang che ba dang / gang snum dang 'gras shing snum la mi dga' ba dang / chang dang che zhing rtag tu chang 'thungs pa dang / de bzhin du rtag tu bud med bsten pa dang / rtag par snum bsten pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du skom gyis gdungs shing skom dang che ba dang / gang snum dang 'gras shing snum la mi dga' ba dang / chang dang che zhing rtag tu chang 'thungs pa dang / de bzhin du rtag tu bud med bsten pa dang / rtag par snum bsten pa dang /
translated: Similarly, it is beneficial for those tormented by thirst, those who desire alcohol, those who dislike oil, those who always drink alcohol, and those who always rely on women.

original: pho ba'i me drod chung ba dang / bde zhing skyid de 'dug pa dang / dka' ba mi bzod cing sdug bsngal bsten par mi nus pa dang / lto ba snyi ba dang / nad dkyel chung ba dang / tsha ba'i dus te so ga'i dus dang /
analyzed: pho ba'i me drod chung ba dang / bde zhing skyid de 'dug pa dang / dka' ba mi bzod cing sdug bsngal bsten par mi nus pa dang / lto ba snyi ba dang / nad dkyel chung ba dang / tsha ba'i dus te so ga'i dus dang /
translated: It is beneficial for those with weak digestive heat, those who are comfortable and happy, those who cannot endure hardship and are unable to endure suffering, those with a soft belly, those with little illness, and those in the hot season.

original: nyam chung ba ste /
analyzed: nyam chung ba ste /
translated: It is beneficial for the weak.

original: lung zungs zad pa rnams te /
analyzed: lung zungs zad pa rnams te /
translated: It is beneficial for those with depleted vital essence.

original: de thams cad la brta ba'i snum bsags shing phan pa yin no //
analyzed: de thams cad la brta ba'i snum bsags shing phan pa yin no //
translated: All of these should accumulate oil and it is beneficial.

original: dang bo bar dang zas rjes zos //
analyzed: dang bo bar dang zas rjes zos //
translated: First, in between, and after meals,

original: lus kyi smad bar stong las byung //
analyzed: lus kyi smad bar stong las byung //
translated: arising from the lower part of the body.

original: nad rnams sel zhing lus kyi stobs //
analyzed: nad rnams sel zhing lus kyi stobs //
translated: It removes illnesses and produces bodily strength,

original: skyed ba'i rim bzhin byed pa yin //
analyzed: skyed ba'i rim bzhin byed pa yin //
translated: functioning in the proper sequence.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /

original: brta ba zhes bya ba'i snum chung du zas kyi dang por btang na lus kyi ro smad las byung ba'i nad rnams sel bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: brta ba zhes bya ba'i snum chung du zas kyi dang por btang na lus kyi ro smad las byung ba'i nad rnams sel bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The term “to be applied” means that if oil is applied at the beginning of a meal, it will remove diseases that arise from the lower part of the body.

original: zas kyi bar du btang na lus kyi bar gyi nad sel to //
analyzed: zas kyi bar du btang na lus kyi bar gyi nad sel to //
translated: If it is applied in the middle of a meal, it will remove diseases that arise from the middle of the body.

original: zas kyi rjes la btang na ro stod las byung ba'i nad rnams sel bar byed do //
analyzed: zas kyi rjes la btang na ro stod las byung ba'i nad rnams sel bar byed do //
translated: If it is applied at the end of a meal, it will remove diseases that arise from the upper part of the body.

original: des na rim ba bzhin te /
analyzed: des na rim ba bzhin te /
translated: Therefore, it is in order.

original: go rims ma 'chol lus zhes bya bar ro stod dang ro smad kyi stobs skyed pa @198a * //🔽yin no // des na zas kyi dang por btang na ro smad du gtogs la /
analyzed: go rims ma 'chol lus zhes bya bar ro stod dang ro smad kyi stobs skyed pa @198a * // yin no // des na zas kyi dang por btang na ro smad du gtogs la /
translated: The term “in order” means that oil is applied to the lower part of the body,

original: rked pa la sogs pa'i lus kyi stobs skyed par byed ba yin no //🔽zas kyi bar du btang na lus kyi bar ma lto ba dang snying ga la sogs pa'i stobs skyed par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: rked pa la sogs pa'i lus kyi stobs skyed par byed ba yin no // zas kyi bar du btang na lus kyi bar ma lto ba dang snying ga la sogs pa'i stobs skyed par byed pa yin no //
translated: which generates strength in the upper and lower parts of the body.🔽If it is applied in the middle of a meal, it generates strength in the middle of the body, in the stomach, heart, and so on.

original: zas kyi rjes la btang na nam tshong yan chad kyi lus po la sogs pa'i stobs skyed pa yin no //
analyzed: zas kyi rjes la btang na nam tshong yan chad kyi lus po la sogs pa'i stobs skyed pa yin no //
translated: If it is applied at the end of a meal, it generates strength in the upper part of the body, in the shoulders and so on.

original: da ni snum 'thung ba'i rjes la btung ba'i cho ga bstan par bya ba'i phyir smras pa ni /
analyzed: da ni snum 'thung ba'i rjes la btung ba'i cho ga bstan par bya ba'i phyir smras pa ni /
translated: Now, in order to teach the rite of drinking after consuming oil, it is said:

original: de ni legs par smin phyir dang // khar chags pa ni phyi pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de ni legs par smin phyir dang // khar chags pa ni phyi pa'i phyir //
translated: Because it is well digested, and because of the attachment to the mouth,

original: snum dag 'thungs rjes chu tshan btung //
analyzed: snum dag 'thungs rjes chu tshan btung //
translated: after consuming oil, one should drink hot water.

original: ae ran ba la ta kar min //
analyzed: ae ran ba la ta kar min //
translated: Not in the case of sesame and mustard oil.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: In this regard,

original: snum dangs ma 'thungs pa'i rjes la bde bar 'ju bar bya ba'i phyir smras pa ni /
analyzed: snum dangs ma 'thungs pa'i rjes la bde bar 'ju bar bya ba'i phyir smras pa ni /
translated: after consuming oil, in order to facilitate its digestion, it is said:

original: de bzhin te /
analyzed: de bzhin te /
translated: Just so.

original: de'i khar chags pa dag ma gos shing dag par bya ba'i phyir chu tshan btung bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i khar chags pa dag ma gos shing dag par bya ba'i phyir chu tshan btung bar bya'o //
translated: In order to remove and purify the attachment to the mouth, one should drink hot water.

original: snum dangs ma btung ba thams cad la chu tshan btung bar bya ba'am /
analyzed: snum dangs ma btung ba thams cad la chu tshan btung bar bya ba'am /
translated: Should one drink hot water after consuming all oils,

original: 'on te 'ga' zhig la btung bar bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te 'ga' zhig la btung bar bya zhe na /
translated: or should one drink it after consuming some?

original: ae ran ba la ta kar min zhes smras pa yin te /
analyzed: ae ran ba la ta kar min zhes smras pa yin te /
translated: It is said, Not in the case of sesame and mustard oil.

original: ae randa dang ba la ta ka'i snum 'thungs pa'i skabs su ni /
analyzed: ae randa dang ba la ta ka'i snum 'thungs pa'i skabs su ni /
translated: In the case of consuming sesame and mustard oil,

original: chu tshan btung bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: chu tshan btung bar mi bya ste /
translated: one should not drink hot water.

original: 'di gnyis ni nus pa chung ba dang ldan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di gnyis ni nus pa chung ba dang ldan pa'i phyir /
translated: Because these two are weak in power,

original: de dag gi gnod pa skyed pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag gi gnod pa skyed pa yin no //
translated: they cause harm.

original: zhu 'am ma zhu'i dogs skye na //
analyzed: zhu 'am ma zhu'i dogs skye na //
translated: If one is doubtful about whether or not it has been digested,

original: slar yang chu tshan btung bar bya //🔽des ni sgregs pa dag 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: slar yang chu tshan btung bar bya // des ni sgregs pa dag 'gyur zhing //
translated: one should drink hot water again.🔽By that, the belching is purified

original: de las khong yang yi gar 'ong //
analyzed: de las khong yang yi gar 'ong //
translated: and the stomach is pleased by it.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here,

original: snum dangs ma 'thungs ba'i tshe /
analyzed: snum dangs ma 'thungs ba'i tshe /
translated: when one drinks the refined oil,

original: zhu'am ma zhu ba'i dogs pa skyes shing yid gnyis su gyur na /
analyzed: zhu'am ma zhu ba'i dogs pa skyes shing yid gnyis su gyur na /
translated: if one is doubtful about whether or not it has been digested,

original: slar zhing yang chu tshan btung bar bya ste /
analyzed: slar zhing yang chu tshan btung bar bya ste /
translated: one should drink hot water again.

original: chu tshan de dang des ni sgregs pa dag cing mnam pa med par 'gyur ba dang / de yang de las lus khong yang bar 'gyur ba dang / de bzhin du yi gar 'ong ba ste /
analyzed: chu tshan de dang des ni sgregs pa dag cing mnam pa med par 'gyur ba dang / de yang de las lus khong yang bar 'gyur ba dang / de bzhin du yi gar 'ong ba ste /
translated: By that, the belching is purified and becomes odorless, and the stomach is pleased by it, and likewise, it becomes pleasing,

original: zas la 'dod pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zas la 'dod pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and desire for food arises.🔽If one drinks it in the morning or has drunk it,

original: nang bar 'thung ngam 'thungs ba dang // 'thungs bar gyur tshe kha zas ran //
analyzed: nang bar 'thung ngam 'thungs ba dang // 'thungs bar gyur tshe kha zas ran //
translated: when it is time for food,

original: gsher drod bad kan mi skyed dang // shin tu snum min 'dres min bza' //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gsher drod bad kan mi skyed dang // shin tu snum min 'dres min bza' // zhes bya ba la /
translated: He should eat food that is mostly liquid and unctuous, not producing phlegm, not very oily, and not mixed.

original: snum 'thungs pa'i skyes bu des kha zas bza' bar bya ba la /
analyzed: snum 'thungs pa'i skyes bu des kha zas bza' bar bya ba la /
translated: The person who has drunk oil should eat food.

original: de yang ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: de yang ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is that like?🔽Mostly liquid and moist, not producing phlegm, not very oily,

original: phal cher gsher zhing rlan bag yod pa dang / dro ba'i bad kan mi skye ba dang / shin tu snum pa ma yin pa ste /🔽cung @198b zad snum pa dang 'dres pa ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: phal cher gsher zhing rlan bag yod pa dang / dro ba'i bad kan mi skye ba dang / shin tu snum pa ma yin pa ste / cung @198b zad snum pa dang 'dres pa ma yin pa ste /
translated: slightly oily, and not mixed.

original: zas gnod pa dang 'dren mar ma yin pa bza' bar bya'o //
analyzed: zas gnod pa dang 'dren mar ma yin pa bza' bar bya'o //
translated: He should eat food that is not harmful and not mixed.

original: de yang ci zhig byed pa'i tshe zhe na nang par te /
analyzed: de yang ci zhig byed pa'i tshe zhe na nang par te /
translated: When should he do that? In the morning.

original: phyed de nyin na 'thung bar rtog pa'am /
analyzed: phyed de nyin na 'thung bar rtog pa'am /
translated: In the afternoon, he should think about drinking.

original: yang de bzhin du nyin zhag de nyid kyis 'thung ba dang / de bzhin du dang por gang gis snum 'thungs pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: yang de bzhin du nyin zhag de nyid kyis 'thung ba dang / de bzhin du dang por gang gis snum 'thungs pa de'i tshe /
translated: Or, in the same way, he should drink on that very day, and in the same way, at first, when he has drunk oil,

original: kha zas 'di ltar bza' ba'o //
analyzed: kha zas 'di ltar bza' ba'o //
translated: he should eat food like this.

original: kha lag chu tshan gyis bkru zhing //
analyzed: kha lag chu tshan gyis bkru zhing //
translated: He should wash his mouth with hot water,

original: bud med mi bsten mtshan mo nyal //
analyzed: bud med mi bsten mtshan mo nyal //
translated: and not rely on women, sleeping at night.

original: shugs dgag drag shul las rnams dang // khro dang mya ngan nyi tshan grang //
analyzed: shugs dgag drag shul las rnams dang // khro dang mya ngan nyi tshan grang //
translated: One should avoid violent, strenuous activities, anger, grief, heat, and cold.

original: ser bu'i khar 'dug rta zhon 'gro //
analyzed: ser bu'i khar 'dug rta zhon 'gro //
translated: One should ride on a horse that is well-trained and well-bred.🔽One should sit on a high seat, speak little, and avoid sleeping during the day.

original: mang smra rab mtho'i stan la 'dug / sngas ni rab mtho rab dma' dang // nyin nyal dud rdul gnas pa spangs //
analyzed: mang smra rab mtho'i stan la 'dug / sngas ni rab mtho rab dma' dang // nyin nyal dud rdul gnas pa spangs //
translated: One should avoid pillows that are too high or too low, and sleeping in dust or smoke.

original: gang gis nyin mo 'thungs gyur pa //🔽de ltar gzhan la spang bar bya //
analyzed: gang gis nyin mo 'thungs gyur pa // de ltar gzhan la spang bar bya //
translated: One should not drink during the day.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: One should avoid these and other similar things.

original: snum 'thungs pa'i skyes bus kha lag bkru ba la sogs pa /
analyzed: snum 'thungs pa'i skyes bus kha lag bkru ba la sogs pa /
translated: The person who drinks oil should wash his hands and so on.

original: chu'i bya ba chu dron pes bya ba dang / bud med bsten cing nyal bo spang bar bya ba dang / de bzhin du mtshan mo nyal zhing bde bar gnyid log par bya ba dang / de bzhin du bshang gci la sogs pa shugs mi dgag pa dang /
analyzed: chu'i bya ba chu dron pes bya ba dang / bud med bsten cing nyal bo spang bar bya ba dang / de bzhin du mtshan mo nyal zhing bde bar gnyid log par bya ba dang / de bzhin du bshang gci la sogs pa shugs mi dgag pa dang /
translated: He should do the water-ritual with warm water, avoid intercourse with women, and sleep. Similarly, he should sleep at night and sleep comfortably. He should not suppress the urges to defecate, urinate, and so on.

original: de bzhin du drag shul gyi las rnams dang khro ba nas dud pa dang rdul gyi nang du 'dug pa'i bar du spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du drag shul gyi las rnams dang khro ba nas dud pa dang rdul gyi nang du 'dug pa'i bar du spang bar bya'o //
translated: He should avoid violent activities and anger, up to sleeping in dust and smoke.

original: de la drag shul gyi las ni dus nub par byed pa'i du ma'o //
analyzed: de la drag shul gyi las ni dus nub par byed pa'i du ma'o //
translated: “Violent actions” are the many that cause the end of time.

original: rab mtho stan gcig mthon po la gcig pu yun ring du mi 'dug pa'o //
analyzed: rab mtho stan gcig mthon po la gcig pu yun ring du mi 'dug pa'o //

translated: On the second day, other than that, phlegm is produced and increased.

original: gang gis she na /🔽de skyed pa yis zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gang gis she na / de skyed pa yis zhes bya ba ste /
translated: By what?🔽By the production of that,

original: bad kan de skyed par byed pa'o //
analyzed: bad kan de skyed par byed pa'o //
translated: phlegm is produced.

original: 'o ma dang nya la sogs pas bad kan bskyed la /
analyzed: 'o ma dang nya la sogs pas bad kan bskyed la /
translated: Milk, fish, and so forth produce phlegm.

original: de'i 'og tu skyug sman gtang ngo //🔽sha che tshil che bad kan mang //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu skyug sman gtang ngo // sha che tshil che bad kan mang //
translated: After that, emetics should be given.🔽Those with much flesh, much fat, and much phlegm,

original: me yi 'ju drod mi snyoms dang // snum la goms pa'i snum bya rnams //
analyzed: me yi 'ju drod mi snyoms dang // snum la goms pa'i snum bya rnams //
translated: with uneven digestive heat of fire, and accustomed to oil,

original: de ni sngon du rtsub chos bya //
analyzed: de ni sngon du rtsub chos bya //
translated: should first perform the rough procedure.

original: de nas snum byas sbyangs gyur na //
analyzed: de nas snum byas sbyangs gyur na //
translated: Then, having been purified by the oil procedure,

original: de la snum nad mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de la snum nad mi 'byung ngo //
translated: phlegm disorders will not occur.

original: snum la goms par gyur pas na //
analyzed: snum la goms par gyur pas na //
translated: By becoming accustomed to oil,

original: dri ma 'thon par nus pa yin //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dri ma 'thon par nus pa yin // zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is able to eliminate impurities.

original: sha che ba ni mi sha rgyas shing sbom pa'o //🔽tshil che ba ni tshil gyis rgyas shing tsho ba'o //
analyzed: sha che ba ni mi sha rgyas shing sbom pa'o // tshil che ba ni tshil gyis rgyas shing tsho ba'o //
translated: Here, “having a lot of flesh” means having a lot of human flesh, that is, being fat.🔽“Having a lot of fat” means being fat and having a lot of fat.

original: bad kan che ba ni bad kan mang ba'o //
analyzed: bad kan che ba ni bad kan mang ba'o //
translated: “Having a lot of phlegm” means having a lot of phlegm.

original: me'i 'ju drod mi snyoms pa ni pho ba'i me drod kyis 'ju ba mi snyoms pa'o //
analyzed: me'i 'ju drod mi snyoms pa ni pho ba'i me drod kyis 'ju ba mi snyoms pa'o //
translated: “Uneven digestive heat” means uneven digestion due to the digestive heat of the stomach.

original: snum la sogs ba ni rtag tu snum za ba ste /
analyzed: snum la sogs ba ni rtag tu snum za ba ste /
translated: “Oily” and so on means always eating oily food.

original: de lta bu'i snum chos gtang bar bya ba gang yin pa de ni sngon du ste /
analyzed: de lta bu'i snum chos gtang bar bya ba gang yin pa de ni sngon du ste /
translated: That which is to be given up, such as oily food, is first, that is, at the beginning.

original: thog mar rtsub pa ni zas dang sman gyis rtsub chos bya la /
analyzed: thog mar rtsub pa ni zas dang sman gyis rtsub chos bya la /
translated: Roughness is to be done with food and medicine.

original: de nas de ltar rtsub chos byas pa'i 'og tu /
analyzed: de nas de ltar rtsub chos byas pa'i 'og tu /
translated: After that, having done that kind of roughness,

original: snum chos byas la sbyangs par gyur na /
analyzed: snum chos byas la sbyangs par gyur na /
translated: if one becomes purified,

original: sha che ba la sogs ba de la snum mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sha che ba la sogs ba de la snum mi 'byung ngo //
translated: then the impurities of having a lot of flesh and so on will not occur.

original: de bzhin du sha che ba la sogs pa rtsub chos byas la /🔽de'i 'og tu snum btang na //
analyzed: de bzhin du sha che ba la sogs pa rtsub chos byas la / de'i 'og tu snum btang na //
translated: Similarly, having a lot of flesh and so on is to be done with roughness.🔽After that, having given up oiliness,

original: snum la goms par gyur pas na //
analyzed: snum la goms par gyur pas na //
translated: one becomes accustomed to oiliness.

original: dri ma 'thon zhing sbyor bar nus pa yin no //
analyzed: dri ma 'thon zhing sbyor bar nus pa yin no //
translated: and he is able to perform the purification.

original: byis pa rgan po la sogs pa //
analyzed: byis pa rgan po la sogs pa //
translated: The child, the aged, and so on,

original: snum spang bar ni mi nus la //
analyzed: snum spang bar ni mi nus la //
translated: are not able to avoid oil.

original: skyo bar mi byed sbyor ba 'dis //
analyzed: skyo bar mi byed sbyor ba 'dis //
translated: By this practice, one does not become weary;

original: 'phral du snum ni sbyar bar bya //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'phral du snum ni sbyar bar bya // zhes bya ba la /
translated: immediately one should apply the oil.

original: snum chos byad pa'i byis pa dang / rgan bo la sogs pa sngar snum chos kyi chogs brta bar bya bar bshad pa rnams snum chos spang bar mi nus ba de lta bu la snum gyi cho ga bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: snum chos byad pa'i byis pa dang / rgan bo la sogs pa sngar snum chos kyi chogs brta bar bya bar bshad pa rnams snum chos spang bar mi nus ba de lta bu la snum gyi cho ga bya ba'i phyir /
translated: The child, the aged, and so on, who are not able to avoid the oil-ritual, as previously explained, for the sake of performing the oil-ritual,

original: de skye zhing bstan bar mi 'gyur ba'i sbyor ba 'dis 'phral du de la snum gyi cho ga sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de skye zhing bstan bar mi 'gyur ba'i sbyor ba 'dis 'phral du de la snum gyi cho ga sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: by this practice, one does not become weary or discouraged, and immediately one should apply the oil-ritual to them.

original: de yang gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: de yang gang yin zhe na /
translated: And what is that?🔽Therein, soup of roasted sesame,🔽and porridge roasted in sesame oil,

original: de la mar brngos sha khu dang // mar brngos pa yi thug pa dang // til phye snum @201a * //🔽bcas bu ram chur ;
analyzed: de la mar brngos sha khu dang // mar brngos pa yi thug pa dang // til phye snum @201a * // bcas bu ram chur ;
translated: sesame flour with oil,🔽and sugar-cane juice,

original: / bcas dang kri sa ra dang ni //
analyzed: / bcas dang kri sa ra dang ni //
translated: and kṛsara,

original: 'o thug mar mang dro ba'am //
analyzed: 'o thug mar mang dro ba'am //
translated: and hot milk with much ghee,

original: bur ma zho dang bcas ba 'am //
analyzed: bur ma zho dang bcas ba 'am //
translated: and curd with sugar-cane,🔽and so on.

original: thug pa snum ni bzhi pa la //
analyzed: thug pa snum ni bzhi pa la //
translated: The fourth is a thick soup.

original: lnga ba 'bras dang ldan par bya //
analyzed: lnga ba 'bras dang ldan par bya //
translated: The fifth is with rice.

original: bdun pa de dag 'phral snum bya //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bdun pa de dag 'phral snum bya // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The seventh is a temporary oil.

original: byis pa dang rgan po la sogs pa rnams la mar brngos pa'i sha khu la sogs pa'i sbyor ba bdun po 'di dag ni 'phral gyi snum gyi cho gar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byis pa dang rgan po la sogs pa rnams la mar brngos pa'i sha khu la sogs pa'i sbyor ba bdun po 'di dag ni 'phral gyi snum gyi cho gar 'gyur ro //
translated: These seven preparations of meat broth boiled with butter, etc. are the rite of temporary oil for the young, the old, etc.

original: de la sha mang po mar dang brngos pa de'i khu ba ni sbyor bag yin no //
analyzed: de la sha mang po mar dang brngos pa de'i khu ba ni sbyor bag yin no //
translated: Therein, the broth of many meats boiled with butter is the first preparation.

original: yang mar mang po dang brngos shing btsos pa'i thug pa byas pa ni sbyor ba gnyis pa yin no //
analyzed: yang mar mang po dang brngos shing btsos pa'i thug pa byas pa ni sbyor ba gnyis pa yin no //
translated: Again, the thick soup made by boiling with much butter is the second preparation.

original: de bzhin du til gyi phye ma snum dang bcas ba dang / bu ram chu dang bcas par sbyar ba ni gsum pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du til gyi phye ma snum dang bcas ba dang / bu ram chu dang bcas par sbyar ba ni gsum pa yin no //
translated: Similarly, sesame flour with oil and molasses with water is the third preparation.

original: 'dir snum ni mar la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir snum ni mar la sogs pa'o //
translated: Here, oil is butter, etc.

original: bu ram chung du ni bu ram phra mo'o //
analyzed: bu ram chung du ni bu ram phra mo'o //
translated: Small molasses is fine sugar.

original: de bzhin du kri sa ra zhes bya ba ni til dang 'bras la sogs pa las byas pa'i thug pa gar thug 'dra ba la snum gyi bu ram chung ngu btab pa ni bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du kri sa ra zhes bya ba ni til dang 'bras la sogs pa las byas pa'i thug pa gar thug 'dra ba la snum gyi bu ram chung ngu btab pa ni bzhi pa'o //
translated: Likewise, krisara is a porridge made from sesame, rice, etc., like a paste, with a little oil and molasses, the fourth.

original: yang na 'o ma ni thug pa ste /
analyzed: yang na 'o ma ni thug pa ste /
translated: Or, milk is porridge.

original: 'o ma dang btsos pa'i thug pa zhun mar mang po bcug pa dro ba ste lnga pa'o //
analyzed: 'o ma dang btsos pa'i thug pa zhun mar mang po bcug pa dro ba ste lnga pa'o //
translated: Milk porridge with a lot of ghee, warm, is the fifth.

original: yang bu ram zho dang bcas pa'i rin ni drug pa'o //
analyzed: yang bu ram zho dang bcas pa'i rin ni drug pa'o //
translated: Or, the price of molasses with curd is the sixth.

original: yang na thug sna lnga pa zhes bya ba snum bzhi po zhun mar dang til mar dang rkang dang tshil dang / srang gnyis dang ldan pa yin pas na de'i thug pa ni bdun pa'o //
analyzed: yang na thug sna lnga pa zhes bya ba snum bzhi po zhun mar dang til mar dang rkang dang tshil dang / srang gnyis dang ldan pa yin pas na de'i thug pa ni bdun pa'o //
translated: Or, the porridge of the five oils is called the fifth, with the four oils of ghee, sesame oil, bone oil, and fat, and two ounces of oil. Therefore, its porridge is the seventh.

original: sbyor ba 'di dag ni 'phral du snum gyi bya ba byed cing skyo ba dang sun par mi byed pa yin no //
analyzed: sbyor ba 'di dag ni 'phral du snum gyi bya ba byed cing skyo ba dang sun par mi byed pa yin no //
translated: These preparations immediately perform the function of oil and do not cause disgust or revulsion.

original: snum rnams lan tshva cher btab pa //
analyzed: snum rnams lan tshva cher btab pa //
translated: The oils with a lot of salt

original: de ni bad kan skyed rtsub min //
analyzed: de ni bad kan skyed rtsub min //
translated: produce phlegm, are not rough,

original: phra zhing drol lus khyab byed //
analyzed: phra zhing drol lus khyab byed //
translated: subtle, warm, and pervade the body.

original: ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la /
translated: It is said:

original: de bzhin du snum bzhi po zhun mar dang til mar dang rkang dang tshil zhes bya ba lan tshva cher btab pa ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du snum bzhi po zhun mar dang til mar dang rkang dang tshil zhes bya ba lan tshva cher btab pa ni /
translated: Likewise, the four oils are clarified butter, sesame oil, bone oil, and fat oil.

original: 'phral du snum par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: 'phral du snum par byed pa yin te /
translated: The oil that is mixed with a lot of salt is immediately nourishing.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: lan tshva btab pa de ni bad kan skye zhing 'dzag pa'i rang bzhin can yin pa dang / de rtsub pa ma yin zhing snum pa dang phra ba ste /
analyzed: lan tshva btab pa de ni bad kan skye zhing 'dzag pa'i rang bzhin can yin pa dang / de rtsub pa ma yin zhing snum pa dang phra ba ste /
translated: The oil mixed with salt has the nature of producing and dripping phlegm, and it is not rough, but oily and fine.

original: phra mo rnams la 'jug cing khyab par byed pa dang / dro zhing tsha ba'i nus pa dang ldan pa dang / lus khyab par byed pa ste /
analyzed: phra mo rnams la 'jug cing khyab par byed pa dang / dro zhing tsha ba'i nus pa dang ldan pa dang / lus khyab par byed pa ste /
translated: It penetrates and spreads into the fine parts, and it has the power to be warm and hot, and it spreads throughout the body.

original: lus ma lus par khyab nas smin cing 'ju ba'i don byed pa yin pas /
analyzed: lus ma lus par khyab nas smin cing 'ju ba'i don byed pa yin pas /
translated: Having spread throughout the entire body, it performs the function of ripening and digesting.

original: lan tshva cher btab pa'i snum ni 'phral du snum chos su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lan tshva cher btab pa'i snum ni 'phral du snum chos su 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the oil that is mixed with a lot of salt is immediately nourishing.

original: mdze dang skran @201b nad gcin snyi la //
analyzed: mdze dang skran @201b nad gcin snyi la //
translated: For leprosy, tumors, and urinary stones,

original: bu ram bcas bza' 'o ma sha / til dang ma sha chang dang zho //
analyzed: bu ram bcas bza' 'o ma sha / til dang ma sha chang dang zho //
translated: eat sugar with milk, meat, sesame, and alcohol,

original: snum bya'i don du mi bya'o //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: snum bya'i don du mi bya'o //🔽zhes bya ba la /
translated: but not for the purpose of oiling.

original: mdze nad la sogs pa yod pa la snum gyi cho gar bza' ba bur ma dang bcas pa 'di dag btang zhing sbyin par mi bya'o //
analyzed: mdze nad la sogs pa yod pa la snum gyi cho gar bza' ba bur ma dang bcas pa 'di dag btang zhing sbyin par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not give these oily preparations to those who have leprosy and so on, together with the food and drink.

original: de ltar snum gyi chogs ci zhig bya zhe na ;
analyzed: de ltar snum gyi chogs ci zhig bya zhe na ;
translated: What is the use of oily preparations?

original: 'bras gsum pi pi ling gu gul //
analyzed: 'bras gsum pi pi ling gu gul //
translated: The three myrobalans, long pepper, and frankincense,

original: aa rur la sogs bskol la //
analyzed: aa rur la sogs bskol la //
translated: are boiled with yellow myrobalan and so on.

original: de dag snum la ji bzhin du //
analyzed: de dag snum la ji bzhin du //
translated: As with those oily preparations,

original: gnod pa med par sbyar bar bya //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gnod pa med par sbyar bar bya // zhes bya ba la /
translated: they are applied without harm.

original: gong du smos pa'i mdze nad la sogs pa de dag la snum 'bras bu gsum dang / pi pi ling dang / gu gul dang / aa ru ra la sogs pa nad dang ji ltar 'tsham pa bzhin du gnod pa med cing mi 'phrod pa med par legs par sbyar zhing gtang bar bya'o //
analyzed: gong du smos pa'i mdze nad la sogs pa de dag la snum 'bras bu gsum dang / pi pi ling dang / gu gul dang / aa ru ra la sogs pa nad dang ji ltar 'tsham pa bzhin du gnod pa med cing mi 'phrod pa med par legs par sbyar zhing gtang bar bya'o //
translated: Those with leprosy and so on mentioned above should be given the three myrobalans, long pepper, frankincense, yellow myrobalan, and so on, well prepared and applied without harm or incompatibility according to the illness.

original: nad kyis nyam chung gyur pa la //🔽lus drod stobs skyed nus pa gtang //
analyzed: nad kyis nyam chung gyur pa la // lus drod stobs skyed nus pa gtang //
translated: To those weakened by illness,

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: give what can generate bodily heat and strength.

original: nad kyis nyam chung zhing sbeg pa'i mi la /
analyzed: nad kyis nyam chung zhing sbeg pa'i mi la /
translated: To those people weakened and emaciated by illness,

original: snum gyi cho ga lus kyi me drod skyed par nus pa'i sman gtang bar bya'o //
analyzed: snum gyi cho ga lus kyi me drod skyed par nus pa'i sman gtang bar bya'o //
translated: The ritual of oil is to administer medicine capable of generating bodily heat.

original: de yang lus me drod ni lus dro ba ste /
analyzed: de yang lus me drod ni lus dro ba ste /
translated: Moreover, bodily heat is the warmth of the body.

original: de gnyis skyed par nus pa'i snum de gtang ba ste /
analyzed: de gnyis skyed par nus pa'i snum de gtang ba ste /
translated: The oil capable of generating those two should be administered.

original: lus kyi stobs skyed par nus pa ni rgyas shing 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lus kyi stobs skyed par nus pa ni rgyas shing 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
translated: That which is capable of generating bodily strength will increase and expand.

original: drod kyi stobs skyed par nus pa ni pho ba'i me drod skyed par byed pa'o //
analyzed: drod kyi stobs skyed par nus pa ni pho ba'i me drod skyed par byed pa'o //
translated: That which is capable of generating the strength of heat will generate the heat of the stomach.

original: skyes bu snum la brten par byed pa rnams //
analyzed: skyes bu snum la brten par byed pa rnams //
translated: Those who rely on oil🔽have inner heat, a pure stomach,

original: nang gi drod 'bar khong pa dag pa dang // lus zungs 'phral brta stobs dang mdog bzang ldan //
analyzed: nang gi drod 'bar khong pa dag pa dang // lus zungs 'phral brta stobs dang mdog bzang ldan //
translated: strong and healthy body constituents, strength, and a good complexion.

original: dbang brtan rgas sra lo brgya thub par 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dbang brtan rgas sra lo brgya thub par 'gyur // zhes bya ba la /
translated: They have stable faculties, are strong and firm, and will live for a hundred years.

original: lus kyi stobs dang pho ba'i me drod skyed par byed pa'i snum la brtan pa'i skyes bu dag gi lus la 'byung ba'i yon tan ni /
analyzed: lus kyi stobs dang pho ba'i me drod skyed par byed pa'i snum la brtan pa'i skyes bu dag gi lus la 'byung ba'i yon tan ni /
translated: Here, the qualities that arise in the bodies of those who rely on oil, which is capable of generating bodily strength and the heat of the stomach, are as follows.

original: nang gi me drod kyis lus thams cad la khyab par 'bar ba dang / khong pa'i nang gi nad skyed par byed pa'i snyigs ma sogs dag par 'gyur ba dang / lus kyi zungs dang stobs gsar du rgyas shing 'phel bar 'gyur ba dang / kha dog bzang zhing yid du 'ong bar 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: nang gi me drod kyis lus thams cad la khyab par 'bar ba dang / khong pa'i nang gi nad skyed par byed pa'i snyigs ma sogs dag par 'gyur ba dang / lus kyi zungs dang stobs gsar du rgyas shing 'phel bar 'gyur ba dang / kha dog bzang zhing yid du 'ong bar 'gyur ba dang /
translated: The body becomes beautiful and attractive.

original: dbang po brtan pa ste /
analyzed: dbang po brtan pa ste /
translated: The senses become stable.

original: mig la sogs pa'i dbang po rang gi bya ba byed bar nus shing /🔽gsal bar 'gyur ba dang / rgas sra zhing skra dkar med par 'gyur ba dang / lo brgya 'tsho zhing gnas pas na /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i dbang po rang gi bya ba byed bar nus shing / gsal bar 'gyur ba dang / rgas sra zhing skra dkar med par 'gyur ba dang / lo brgya 'tsho zhing gnas pas na /
translated: The senses, such as the eyes, become capable of performing their functions.🔽They become clear.🔽The body becomes firm and free of gray hair.

original: lo brgya thub ba ste /🔽snum la brten pa'i skyes bu la @202a * //
analyzed: lo brgya thub ba ste / snum la brten pa'i skyes bu la @202a * //
translated: The body lives and remains for a hundred years.

original: yon tan 'byung bar drang srong rnams kyis bshad cing bstan pa'o //
analyzed: yon tan 'byung bar drang srong rnams kyis bshad cing bstan pa'o //
translated: The sages have explained and taught that these qualities arise in those who rely on oil.

original: yan lag brgyad pa'i snying po bsdus pa'i rnam par 'grel pa tshig gi don gyi zla zer zhes bya ba /
analyzed: yan lag brgyad pa'i snying po bsdus pa'i rnam par 'grel pa tshig gi don gyi zla zer zhes bya ba /
translated: The Moonlight: A Commentary on the Meaning of the Words of the Essence of the Eight Branches

original: slob dpon zla ba la dga' bas rnam par sbyar ba las le'u bcu drug pa'i rnam par 'grel pa'o /
analyzed: slob dpon zla ba la dga' bas rnam par sbyar ba las le'u bcu drug pa'i rnam par 'grel pa'o /
translated: This is the commentary on the sixteenth chapter of the Bodhisattva Section of the Yogācārabhūmi, called “The Chapter on the Hot Bath.”

original: // / de nas dugs kyi cho ga'i le'u bshad par bya'o //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: // / de nas dugs kyi cho ga'i le'u bshad par bya'o // zhes bya ba la /
translated: Now, the chapter on the hot bath will be explained.

original: dugs ni phal cher dang por snum chos byas nas 'dir bya dgos pas na /
analyzed: dugs ni phal cher dang por snum chos byas nas 'dir bya dgos pas na /
translated: Here, “hot bath” is mostly done after first applying oil, so it is necessary to do it here.

original: de'i phyir snum gyi cho ga'i 'og tu dugs kyi cho ga'i le'u bshad cing bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir snum gyi cho ga'i 'og tu dugs kyi cho ga'i le'u bshad cing bstan pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, after the chapter on oil, the chapter on the hot bath is explained and taught.

original: de yang drang srong tsar kas //
analyzed: de yang drang srong tsar kas //
translated: And that is explained by the sage Caraka:

original: dugs kyis gso bar bya ba'i nad //
analyzed: dugs kyis gso bar bya ba'i nad //
translated: The disease to be cured by the hot bath,

original: rlung dang bad kan bdag nyid can //🔽snum gyi dngos su 'gro ba yi //
analyzed: rlung dang bad kan bdag nyid can // snum gyi dngos su 'gro ba yi //
translated: which has the nature of wind and phlegm,🔽is directly pacified by the hot bath

original: dugs kyis rab tu zhi bar 'gyur //🔽zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: dugs kyis rab tu zhi bar 'gyur // zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: of one who has applied oil.

original: dugs kyi cho ga ni las su bya ba nyid de /
analyzed: dugs kyi cho ga ni las su bya ba nyid de /
translated: The hot bath is the very thing to be done.

original: de'i tshul gyi le'u yin pas na dugs kyi le'u'o //
analyzed: de'i tshul gyi le'u yin pas na dugs kyi le'u'o //
translated: Since it is the chapter on the method of that, it is the chapter on the hot bath.

original: de la dugs kyi cho ga ni dbye ba'i dbang du byas nas smras pa ni /
analyzed: de la dugs kyi cho ga ni dbye ba'i dbang du byas nas smras pa ni /
translated: There, the hot bath is said from the perspective of its divisions:

original: dugs bsro bcing dang tha mal pa //
analyzed: dugs bsro bcing dang tha mal pa //
translated: The hot bath, the binding, and the ordinary,

original: chu dugs dbye bas rnam pa bzhi //
analyzed: chu dugs dbye bas rnam pa bzhi //
translated: There are four types of hot compresses.

analyzed: mar la sogs pa nad gang dang gang la phan pa'i snum de dang de dag dang ldan bar bya ba dang / de bzhin du de dang mnyam pa'i chang la sogs pa dang btsos pa nad dmigs ji lta bu las dpags te / blugs pa'i chu de bum ba mchu phra mo btod ba'i mchus blugs @204a * //
translated: One should apply the oil that is beneficial for whatever illness there is, such as for downward-moving wind disorders, and so on.🔽Likewise, one should cook it with liquor and so forth that is equal to that, and pour it into a vase with a narrow neck.

original: par bya ste /
analyzed: par bya ste /

analyzed: spu gu ni ring po kha gyen du bltas pa'i nang du bcug ste / bkang la nad kyis nyam thag pa ste /

original: gzer la sogs pas nyon mongs par gyur pa'i lus gos kyis dkris la /
analyzed: gzer la sogs pas nyon mongs par gyur pa'i lus gos kyis dkris la /

original: snum zhing rlung 'joms pa'i sman bskol ba blugs par bya ste /
analyzed: snum zhing rlung 'joms pa'i sman bskol ba blugs par bya ste /

original: de yang bde ba ste /
analyzed: de yang bde ba ste /

analyzed: ci bde ba la reg par gyur pa'i tshul du bya ste / 'dir lan 'ga' cung zad dro bas bya'o //

original: lan 'ga' ni shin tu dro bas bya'o //
analyzed: lan 'ga' ni shin tu dro bas bya'o //
translated: Sometimes it is done with a lot of heat.

original: de blugs pa ni chu'i rgyun gyi khyad par gang zhig gis rgyun mi 'chad par blugs shing chu la sogs pa'i gsher rdzas 'dzag par 'gyur bas na blugs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de blugs pa ni chu'i rgyun gyi khyad par gang zhig gis rgyun mi 'chad par blugs shing chu la sogs pa'i gsher rdzas 'dzag par 'gyur bas na blugs pa zhes bya'o //

original: chu'i dugs ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: chu'i dugs ni rnam pa gnyis te /

analyzed: de ltar blugs pa bshad zin nas /

original: da ni chu la bcing ba bshad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni chu la bcing ba bshad pa'i phyir /

original: lus la zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: lus la zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad pa yin te /
translated: it is explained with on the body, etc.

analyzed: de nyid kyis zhes bya ba sngar bshad pa'i sman tsho snod chen po bkang la /

analyzed: bkang ba'i snod der nad pa bcug ste /

analyzed: snying ga la sogs pa bsrung bzhin gnas par bya'o //

original: snod ces smos pa ni spyi ming tsam du nye bar mtshon pa tsam ste /
analyzed: snod ces smos pa ni spyi ming tsam du nye bar mtshon pa tsam ste /
translated: Vessel is merely a general name, just an illustration.

original: zangs chen po'am /
analyzed: zangs chen po'am /
translated: A large copper vessel,

analyzed: gzhong pa ring po chen po sman chus bkang ba'i nang du 'jug cing bcings te gnas par bya'o //
translated: He should be placed in a large, long trough filled with medicinal water, and kept there.

original: de bzhin du gzhang 'brum dang / gcin sri ba la sogs pa lus kyi phyogs gcig na bar gyur pa la ni nad la sogs tshul las dpags te sbyar bar bya'o //

translated: Similarly, in the case of hemorrhoids, urinary retention, and so on, when there is illness in one part of the body, one should apply [the treatment] according to the method of illness and so on.

original: rlung med phyi nang snum bcas shing //
analyzed: rlung med phyi nang snum bcas shing //

original: zas 'ju'i dus su dugs dpyad bya //
analyzed: zas 'ju'i dus su dugs dpyad bya //

original: nad dang nad pa yul dus kyi //
analyzed: nad dang nad pa yul dus kyi //
translated: According to the power of illness, patient, place, and time,

original: dbang las chung 'bring chen por bya //
analyzed: dbang las chung 'bring chen por bya //
translated: it should be done in small, medium, or large [degrees].

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here,

analyzed: rlung med pa'i sa phyogs su skyes bu'i lus phyi nang snum dang bcas par byas la /

analyzed: kha zas sman dang zhu zin par gyur ba'i dus su dugs dpyad par bya la /

original: dugs de yang nad la sogs pa'i dbang gis chung ngu la sogs ba'i tshad gsum du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dugs de yang nad la sogs pa'i dbang gis chung ngu la sogs ba'i tshad gsum du 'gyur ro //

original: de yang chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po gsum du 'gyur la /
analyzed: de yang chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po gsum du 'gyur la /

analyzed: de bzhin du nad pa yang stobs la sogs pa la chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po yod de /

original: yul rlan can dang / skam sa 'dren ma gsum yod do //🔽@204b lus kyi gnas mgo dang phrag pa dang / lto ba dang / byin ba la sogs pa'i dbye bas phye ba yin no //
analyzed: yul rlan can dang / skam sa 'dren ma gsum yod do // @204b lus kyi gnas mgo dang phrag pa dang / lto ba dang / byin ba la sogs pa'i dbye bas phye ba yin no //
translated: There are three types of place: moist, dry and mixed.

analyzed: dus ni dro ba dang / grang ba dang / 'dres ma'i dbye bas phye ba yin no //
translated: There are three types of time: hot, cold and mixed.

analyzed: dbang las zhes bya ba ni de dag gtso bor byas pa yin no // bad kan gyis nyen rtsub dugs bya //
translated: The statement “due to the humors” means that they are based on the humors.🔽Those afflicted by phlegm should do a rough hot bath.

original: bad kan rlung la rtsub snum bya //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bad kan rlung la rtsub snum bya // zhes bya ba la /
translated: Those afflicted by wind and phlegm should do a rough oily bath.

analyzed: bad kan gyis nyen cing bad kan shas che ba'i skyes bus dugs rtsub mo bya'o //

original: de bzhin du skyes bu rlung las gyur cing bad kan yang yod pa dag gis dugs gzhan ltar dang por snum chos bya zhing /
analyzed: de bzhin du skyes bu rlung las gyur cing bad kan yang yod pa dag gis dugs gzhan ltar dang por snum chos bya zhing /
translated: Likewise, those afflicted by wind and having phlegm should do an oily bath at first, like the other.

original: bad kan dang rlung yod pas rtsub pa dang / snum pa 'dren ma'i dugs sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: bad kan dang rlung yod pas rtsub pa dang / snum pa 'dren ma'i dugs sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: If there is phlegm and wind, apply a rough or oily poultice.

original: rlung ni ma zhu'i gnas zhugs dang // bad kan zhu ba'i gnas brten la //
analyzed: rlung ni ma zhu'i gnas zhugs dang // bad kan zhu ba'i gnas brten la //

original: gnas kyi dbang gis rtsub dugs dang // de bzhin snum sngar 'gro dugs bya //
analyzed: gnas kyi dbang gis rtsub dugs dang // de bzhin snum sngar 'gro dugs bya //

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: rlung ma zhu'i gnas su zhugs la gnas pa'i nad la ni rtsub pa sngon du 'gro ba'i dugs spyad par bya'o //
translated: If the illness is located in the place of non-digestion, where wind enters and abides, apply a poultice that is rough on the outside.

original: de bzhin du bad kan zhu ba'i gnas la gnas shing brten pa la ni snum sngon du 'gro ba'i dugs bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du bad kan zhu ba'i gnas la gnas shing brten pa la ni snum sngon du 'gro ba'i dugs bya ste /
translated: Similarly, if it is located in the place of digestion, where phlegm abides and is supported, apply a poultice that is oily on the outside.

original: de dag ni gnas kyi dbang gis tshul de ltar bya dgos pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni gnas kyi dbang gis tshul de ltar bya dgos pa yin no //
translated: This is the way it must be done by the power of the place.

original: sta zur dag dang mig dang snying //
analyzed: sta zur dag dang mig dang snying //
translated: The armpits, eyes, heart,

original: rlig par nyung ngu 'am bya ba min //
analyzed: rlig par nyung ngu 'am bya ba min //
translated: and testicles should not be poulticed.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: This is what is meant.

analyzed: sta zur zhes bya ba lus kyi phyogs gcig brla dang / dpyi la brten pa'i nad la dugs nyung du bya'o //
translated: If the illness is located in one part of the body, such as the thigh or hip, which is called the armpit, apply a small poultice.

original: de bzhin du mig dang snying ga dang rlig par ni shin tu chung ba'i dugs bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du mig dang snying ga dang rlig par ni shin tu chung ba'i dugs bya'o //
translated: Likewise, one should take a very mild bath in the eyes, the heart, and the genitals.

original: yang na bya ba min zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: yang na bya ba min zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Or, one should not do it,

original: gnas de dag tu ye mi bya'o //
analyzed: gnas de dag tu ye mi bya'o //
translated: that is, one should not do it at all in those places.

original: dugs kyis grang dang zug gzer bral //
analyzed: dugs kyis grang dang zug gzer bral //
translated: By bathing, one is free from cold and pain,🔽the limbs become flexible,

original: yan lag mnyen par gyur ba dang // dal gyis mnyes la khrus byas la //🔽de nas snum gyi cho ga bsten //
analyzed: yan lag mnyen par gyur ba dang // dal gyis mnyes la khrus byas la // de nas snum gyi cho ga bsten //

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Then, one should rely on the procedure of oil.

original: dugs kyis skyes bu'i grang ba dang / zug gzer bral bas skyes bu'i lus legs par brlan zhing mnyen par 'gyur ba dang / de bzhin du yan lag mnyen zhing 'jam par 'gyur ba dang / dal gyis dang por mnyes la de'i 'og tu khrus bya ba de dang po lag pas yan lag mnyes la chu dron pos khrus byas nas /

translated: By bathing, one is free from the cold and pain of the body, and the body becomes well-moistened and flexible. Likewise, the limbs become flexible and soft. And one should bathe slowly and gently, first massaging the limbs with the hands and then bathing with warm water.

original: de'i 'og tu snum chos kyi skabs nas bshad pa'i cho ga bsten cing spyad par bya ba dang / @205a * //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu snum chos kyi skabs nas bshad pa'i cho ga bsten cing spyad par bya ba dang / @205a * //
